work.summary: Transitioned into a Product role with a focus on creating long-term sustained value from Machine Learning (ML). Developed a new toolkit grounded in discovery and user centricity. Joined the Kedro open source initiative before building my own team focused on ML development productivity.
highlights: Assembled and led team of 14 Engineers and Designers focused on standardisation and driving up the software engineering bar across a globally distributed portfolio of industry specific ML applications.

Incubated a new product (working name Alloy, set to open sourcing Q1 2024) which abstracts the complexities of Python packaging, CI/CD and TDD specifically for Data Scientist and Data Engineer personas.
The practitioner-led roll out of Alloy eliminated the need for dedicated SWE or DevOps resources across the portfolio and reduced average monorepo build times by 70%
Stewarded the Kedro (8.5K Stars) open source project through the admissions process to the Linux Foundation for AI & Data.
Led significant research workteam focused on rethinking Kedro's configuration management mechanism focussing find the right balance between imperative flexibility and declarative readability.
Responsible for driving product telemetry privacy and technical best practices across the organisation. Introduced reporting approach for CLI Python apps and approved consent workflow.

work.summary: Forward deployed Data Engineer working as part of multi-disciplinary teams delivering ML use-cases at a time large Enterprises were just beginning to build up their own Data Science capabilities. Served clients across pharmaceutical, manufacturing, insurance and motorsport contexts.
highlights: Led the development of the Reinforcement Learning (RL) powered race strategy software used by a winning Formula E team to facilitate mid-race decisions between the Drivers and Race Engineers in both cars. Data sources: Physics simulation passes, live race timing information and driver radio input.
Deployed yield and deviation prediction solution for vaccine manufacturing production line. Data sources: SAP Genealogy, OSIsoft PI Sensor Data and custom scheduling software.

Built the data ingestion and feature engineering pipeline for a novel ML analysis approach to track patient journeys outcomes as they switched between various different diabetes treatments. Data sources: Electronic medical records, proprietary clinical trail data.

work.summary: Data driven investigative work focusing on fraud, disputes and trade surveillance. Served clients in crisis situations across many industries, developing a toolkit for analysing poor quality structured and unstructued data using SQL and Python.
highlights: Helped resolve creditor disputes and decommission mainframe machines in the wake of the Lehman Brothers bankruptcy.
Analysed communications in concert with outlier trading activity in relation to LIBOR frontrunning scandal.

awards.title: Best Final Year Student
awards.awarder: University of Birmingham, School of Computer Science
